## Casting gold and silver

The sand must be made from something very dry and arid and reheated well because, if it were humid, like founderâ€™s sand, the gold and silver would leap out of the mold and sustain damage. It is also necessary for the earth to absorb the metal because cast gold or silver become very porous. That is why it must be beaten out again, otherwise it is brittle, as seen in spoon handles.
